Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-06-21T19:23:56
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Ivan Greenberg FBI Research Files on Labor and Radicalism TAM 573
2 Linear Feet in 2 record cartons
1955-2000 Ivan Greenberg is an historian and author.This collecion contains FBI files obtained under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) by Greenberg on the Socialist Scholars Conference, the Socialist Workers Party, Dissent magazine, the Institute for Policy Studies, and Gus Hall. Materials are in English
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Ivan Greenberg in 2011. The accession number associated with this gift is 2011.025.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist; materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical/Biographical Note
Ivan Greenberg is an historian and the author of The Dangers of Dissent: The FBI and Civil Liberties Since 1965 (Lexington Books, 2010).
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Ivan Greenberg FBI Research Files on Labor and Radicalism; TAM 573; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
This collecion contains FBI files obtained under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) by Ivan Greenberg on the Socialist Scholars Conference, the Socialist Workers Party, Dissent magazine, the Institute for Policy Studies, and Gus Hall.
Conditions Governing Use
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1955-2000, are expected to enter the public domain in 2120.
